annonstext:
To support Mölnlycke’s next level of growth, and further develop the way we work in the Finance, IT and People/HR functions, Mölnlycke is establishing a new Global Business Services centre (GBS).

The GBS will be located at Mölnlycke’s headquarters in Gothenburg, complemented by two regional hubs: one in Americas and one in APAC. Once fully populated, the GBS, including the two hubs, will comprise some 100 people.

The launch of the GBS is planned to 1 March 2021 and we are actively recruiting for vacant positions!

We are now looking for a Global Process Developer who will be responsible for continuous improvement and development of the processes owned and used by the GBS Service Desk (Knowledge, Incident & Request management), to gain operational excellence, identify efficiencies and continuously increasing service quality.

 Key Accountabilities

	 Work closely with the Head of Service Desk to realize continuous improvements in the processes and ways of working
	Continuously map, understand and analyse the process flows and operational procedures to identify areas of improvement and recommend changes
	Develop and support the implementation of processes and working methods to increase efficiency
	Advice on technology enablers to support efficient processes, together with IT and super users
	Drive simplification, standardization, automation, and self-service across the entire Mölnlycke global organization
	Coach, guide and support in ways of working
	Manage the transformation of the processes by critically and continuously reviewing the process across in terms of usage and efficiency; suggesting and driving improvement
	Define, implement and measure the relevant process performance indicators in order to drive value, quality, efficiency, usage and compliance
	Responsible to develop new or improved process flows, working procedures and support mechanisms
	Work closely with the Service Desk organization in order to capture and identify improvement opportunities
	Align all process changes with Head of Service Desk and drive the implementation while coordinating both within and outside of the GBS
	Provide education and trainings for new process changes
	Create and update relevant process documents
	Cooperate with Product Owner Service Desk and global IT organization to find technical tools, software and systems supporting process flow optimization where needed
	Keeping up-to-date with general developments in the area of ITSM, ESM and ITIL.

Key Decisions & Competencies

	Implementation of process improvement activities
	Training and knowledge management lifecycle for each process area
	Process changes to facilitate broadening the scope of support for the Service Desk
	Change and transformation management and drive initiatives
	Be able to think holistically and understand and manage complex cross functional processes
	Attention to detail/quality and acting in line with company policies
	Excellent analytical skills, capable of turning data into meaningful information and presentations
	Business partnering profile; a good listener with a good understanding of general business issues
	Self-motivated and self-directed
	Ability to set priorities and create focus on accomplishing set objectives

Qualifications and Experience

	Minimum 6 years’ experience of process development/ business optimization in an international corporate environment
	MedTech background a plus
	Excellent Process Development and Process Management Skills
	High level of IT literacy including deep understanding of Configuration Management (CMDB), self-service portals and user experiences
	Experience and understanding of ITSM and ITIL
	General understanding of process automation through IT enabled solutions
	Fluent in English, spoken and written

About Mölnlycke

Mölnlycke is a world-leading medical solutions company. We design and supply solutions to enhance performance at every point of care – from the hospital to the home proven it every day.

We specialise in:

• Wound management: including dressings with Safetac® such as Mepitel® and Mepilex®

• Preventing pressure ulcers: with Mepilex® Border used prophylactically and devices to help turn and re-position patients

• Surgical solutions: including Mölnlycke trays, HiBi® antiseptics and Biogel® surgical gloves

Mölnlycke was founded in 1849. Nowadays our solutions are available in around 100 countries; we’re the number one global provider of advanced wound care and single-use surgical products; and we’re Europe’s largest provider of customised trays. Our headquarters are in Gothenburg, Sweden and we have about 7,800 employees around the world.
